intro: Sonchus tibesticus, commonly known as the Tibetan sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust growth habit. The plant typically features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its ecological significance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
